excited.description: Sets the spoken text to varying levels of excitement. Valid values are low, medium (default), and high.

emphasis.description: Add or remove emphasis from a word or phrase. Valid values are strong, moderate (default), reduced, none.

date.description: Speak the text as a date. Valid date format values are mdy, dmy, ymd (not universally supported), ydm, md, dm, ym, my, y, m, d.

volume.description: Modify the volume of the speech. Valid volume modifiers are silent, x-soft, soft, medium (default), loud, x-loud. Default to medium if not specified.

disappointed.description: Sets the spoken text to varying levels of disappointment. Valid disappointed modifiers are low, medium (default), high.

time.description: Speak the value as a time. Valid values are hms12, hms24.

lang.description: Sets the language. Words and phrases in other languages usually sound better with the lang tag. Valid values include all supported Amazon Polly language codes.

ordinal.description: Speaks a number as an ordinal: first, second, third, etc.

dj.description: Change the voice to a dj voice. Supported on Alexa only.

default voice.description: Sets the spoken text back to the normal voice for the plaform. Useful when switching to different voices.

newscaster.description: Sets the spoken text similar to how a news announcer would speak them.

address.description: Speaks the selected text as a street address.

unit.description: Speaks the value as a unit. Can be a number and unit or just a unit.

sub.description: Substitute one word or phrase with a different word or phrase. Often used to expand/clarify abbreviations.

phone.description: Speak the number/value as a 7-digit or 10-digit telephone number.

interjection.description: Speaks the text in a more expressive voice.

fraction.description: Speaks the value as a fraction.

characters.description: Speaks a number or text as individual characters.

ipa.description: Provides a phonemic/phonetic pronunciation for the contained text using the International Phonetic Alphabet (IPA).

pitch.description: Raise or lower the tone (pitch) of the speech. Valid values are x-low, low, medium (default), high, x-high.

rate.description: Modify the rate of the speech. Valid values are x-slow, slow, medium (default), fast, x-fast.

audio.description: Plays short, pre-recorded audio. Value in the tag should be a fully qualified URL to a publically accessible audio file.

whisper.description: Speak text in a whispered voice.

number.description: Speaks a number as a cardinal: one, twenty, twelve thousand three hundred forty five, etc.

break ms.description: A pause in speech. Value is set in milliseconds.

break strength.description: A pause in speech. Valid values are none, x-weak, weak, medium, strong, x-strong

voice.description: Apply voice modifier and use any Amazon Polly voice. Updated with all latest voices from Amazon Polly documentation.

voice device.description: Apply voice modifier and switch back to the default device voice

voice en-US.description: Apply voice modifier and limit to en-US voices. Valid values include all US English voices from Amazon Polly.

voice en-UK.description: Apply voice modifier and limit to en-GB voices. Valid values are Amy, Arthur, Brian, and Emma.

voice en-GB-WLS.description: Apply voice modifier and limit to en-GB-WLS (Welsh) Alexa voices. Valid values are Geraint.

voice en-AU.description: Apply voice modifier and limit to en-AU voices. Valid values are Nicole, Olivia, and Russell.

voice en-IN.description: Apply voice modifier and limit to en-IN voices. Valid values are Aditi, Kajal, and Raveena.

voice hi-IN.description: Apply voice modifier and limit to hi-IN voices. Valid values are Aditi and Kajal.

voice de-DE.description: Apply voice modifier and limit to de-DE voices. Valid values are Daniel, Hans, Marlene, and Vicki.

voice es-ES.description: Apply voice modifier and limit to es-ES voices. Valid values are Alba, Conchita, Enrique, Lucia, Raúl, and Sergio.

voice fr-CA.description: Apply voice modifier and limit to fr-CA voices. Valid values are Chantal, Gabrielle, and Liam.

voice it-IT.description: Apply voice modifier and limit to it-IT voices. Valid values are Adriano, Bianca, Carla, and Giorgio.

voice ja-JP.description: Apply voice modifier and limit to ja-JP voices. Valid values are Kazuha, Mizuki, Takumi, and Tomoko.

voice fr-FR.description: Apply voice modifier and limit to fr-FR voices. Valid values are Celine, Lea, Mathieu, and Rémi.

voice pt-BR.description: Apply voice modifier and limit to pt-BR voices. Valid values are Camila, Thiago, and Vitória.

voice es-US.description: Apply voice modifier and limit to es-US voices. Valid values are Lupe, Miguel, Pedro, and Penelope.

voice es-MX.description: Apply voice modifier and limit to es-MX voices. Valid values are Andrés and Mia.

voice ar-AE.description: Apply voice modifier and limit to ar-AE (Arabic Gulf) voices. Valid values are Hala and Zayd.

voice en-IE.description: Apply voice modifier and limit to en-IE (English Ireland) voices. Valid value is Niamh.

voice en-NZ.description: Apply voice modifier and limit to en-NZ (English New Zealand) voices. Valid value is Aria.

voice en-SG.description: Apply voice modifier and limit to en-SG (English Singapore) voices. Valid value is Jasmine.

voice en-ZA.description: Apply voice modifier and limit to en-ZA (English South African) voices. Valid value is Ayanda.

voice ko-KR.description: Apply voice modifier and limit to ko-KR (Korean) voices. Valid values are Jihye and Seoyeon.

voice pl-PL.description: Apply voice modifier and limit to pl-PL (Polish) voices. Valid values are Ewa, Jacek, Jan, Maja, and Ola.
